bibl.title: George Hawkins v. The United States of America. Order Granting Leave to Prosecute in Forma Pauperis
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, IN AND FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of George Hawkins, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, STATE OF WASHINGTON, COUNTY OF KING.
div1.p: Now at this time, November 5th, 1902, this matter coming on to be heard on the motion of James E. Fenton, counsel for the above named petitioner, George Hawkins, for an order of this court, granting the said petitioner George Hawkins, leave to prosecute his petition for a writ of habeas corpus herein, in forma pauperis, and it appearing to the court from the affidavit of James E. Fenton on file herein, that said order should be granted, it is therefore ordered and adjudged that the said petitioner, George Hawkins, be and abd is hereby allowed to prosecute his said petition for a writ of habeas corpus in the above entitled proceedings, without costs or fees of Clerk or other officer of this Court, and without filing security therefor.
div1.ab: C.H. Hanford United States District Judge, in and for the District of Wash.
UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the Application of GEORGE HAWKINS For a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
ORDER GRANTING LEAVE TO PROSECUTE IN FORMA PAUPERIS.

Filed Nov 5. 1902 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk
By RM Hopkins Deputy Clerk
James E. Fenton, Attorney for Plaintiff.
